poem:
**The Delicate Dance of Diplomacy**

Amid the tangled nets and tides,  
a dance unfolds in the paper folds—  
The ink bleeds claims and counterclaims,  
while silver scales gleam unseen.  
Caught in the catch, the voices swell,  
Scotland calls from the sea's edge,  
betrayed it seems, by promised winds  
that never reached the shore.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Starmer rejects claim ‘win-win’ UK-EU deal has sold out fishing sector – UK politics live 3.06pm BST Scottish government welcomes key parts of deal with EU, but says fishing industry has been betrayed Severin Carrell is the Guardian’s Scotland editor. Kate Forbes, Scotland’s economy secretary, has welcomed many of the key parts of the UK deal with the EU but accused Keir Starmer of “selling out” Scotland’s fishing communities, and failing to involve Scottish ministers". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Starmer rejects claim ‘win-win’ UK-EU deal has sold out fishing sector – UK politics live 3.06pm BST Scottish government welcomes key parts of deal with EU, but says fishing industry has been betrayed Severin Carrell is the Guardian’s Scotland editor. Kate Forbes, Scotland’s economy secretary, has welcomed many of the key parts of the UK deal with the EU but accused Keir Starmer of “selling out” Scotland’s fishing communities, and failing to involve Scottish ministers
